ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course was very helpful in figuring out how to prepare for thesis research. We got a sense for the different methods our department can support, including ethnography, archival research, and visual analysis.
Learned different methods, practice with interviews and ethnographies, and how to make a research prospectus.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The bests parts of the course were being able to learn about and discuss our thesis project ideas together as a group and receiving individualized feedback on our ideas from the professor. Being forced to organize and conduct different kinds of interviews was also a valuable experience.

I felt that some of the weeks had a bit too much reading or that the readings were not all very helpful for my work - though this is inevitable due to the wide variety of students interests. I would have liked to do more with the Narayan exercise book.

Research Seminar was difficult for me to figure out as there are readings and lecture/discussions but also a lot of exercises to carry out. If you have a hard time being motivated to do work if the content isnt directly related to your interests, youll struggle in this course just like I did lmao. Unless we were doing something that was connected to my thesis, I had a hard time being able to keep up with assignments. There were a lot of assignments and it wasnt always clear why some of them were assigned or which were the most important. I think the course would benefit from us being able to engage more with each others work as well.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you have to take it, you have to take it. I found the methods structure frustrating.
This is an essential WGSS course for majors.
